revised_title: Exploring Residuary Charge and the Law of Exploding Distance in Electrical Accumulation on Coated Glass
tldr: The author investigates the phenomenon of residuary charge and the law of exploding distance in electrical accumulation on coated glass. They find that the remaining charge after explosive discharge is not due to spreading on the glass or penetration into its substance, but rather an undischarged portion of the accumulation. The author also introduces a new form of the discharging electrometer and discusses the intensity and tension of electrical force in relation to these phenomena.
